extracted_data_phrases: in regards to making decisions for myself

extracted_data_phrases: even among those with whom you have a strong sense of community or
disobedience.question: Did you reject the unity of the Church when struggling to accept the imperfect nature of its members, even among those with whom you have a strong sense of community or shared activities?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

extracted_data_phrases: on days such as Ash Wednesday

extracted_data_phrases: to the deceased and their family

disobedience.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

disobedience.question: Did I mock the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

scandal.question: Did you try to lead someone who trusts your judgment to commit a sinful act through your words, actions, or example?
scandal.description: Leading others to sin (also called "scandal") is sinful because it actively harms another person's soul by encouraging them away from God, making you spiritually responsible both for your own sin and for potentially damaging another's relationship with God.

extracted_data_phrases: through my words , actions , or influence in social situations

scandal.description: Leading others to sin (also called "scandal") is sinful because it actively harms another person's soul by encouraging them away from God, making you spiritually responsible both for your own sin and for potentially damaging another's relationship with God.

extracted_data_phrases: onto fault that could be owned up to
impenitence.question: Have I refused to acknowledge my wrongdoing, stubbornly holding onto fault that could be owned up to?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

impenitence.question: Have I resisted changing my sinful ways, refusing to turn away from sin despite my awareness of it?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: from caring for someone who was ill
callousness.question: Did you intentionally turn away from caring for someone who was ill?
callousness.description: This is sinful because it violates Jesus's direct command to care for the sick (Matthew 25:36) and fails to fulfill our fundamental Christian duty to show compassion and mercy to those who are suffering.

callousness.question: Did I fail to provide care for someone who was ill?
callousness.description: This is sinful because it violates Jesus's direct command to care for the sick (Matthew 25:36) and fails to fulfill our fundamental Christian duty to show compassion and mercy to those who are suffering.

extracted_data_phrases: from someone in my life who was ill
callousness.question: Did I turn away from someone in my life who was ill, thereby failing to show compassion and mercy towards them?
callousness.description: This is sinful because it violates Jesus's direct command to care for the sick (Matthew 25:36) and fails to fulfill our fundamental Christian duty to show compassion and mercy to those who are suffering.

blasphemy.question: Did you "swear to God" in anger, frustration, or under pressure from others?
blasphemy.description: This sin violates the Second Commandment by treating God's holy name with disrespect rather than reverence.

extracted_data_phrases: such as hurting others through my words or actions
blasphemy.question: Did I receive Holy Communion while being fully aware that I had committed serious wrongdoings, such as hurting others through my words or actions?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

ambition.question: Did I let my desire for power and dominance influence how I relate to and interact with those around me, especially in situations where I need to make decisions or assert myself?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: in positions of authority or leadership
ambition.question: Did I allow my desire for power and dominance to influence how I treated others, particularly those in positions of authority or leadership?

ambition.question: Did I let my desire for power influence how I treat others in my community, particularly those who may disagree with me or have different opinions?

extracted_data_phrases: through unjust and cruel exercises of power or authority over them
oppression.question: Have I mistreated others through unjust and cruel exercises of power or authority over them?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted my success and good fortune, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted my blessings in life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence when my plans and efforts seemed successful?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the successes and blessings in my life, assuming they were solely due to my own efforts rather than God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

envy.question: Have I felt envious of others' accomplishments or successes in their careers, sports, or personal endeavors?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

envy.question: Have I secretly wished that others' successes, possessions, or blessings were somehow diminished, so they wouldn't seem greater than mine?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and use my words to speak to others with vulgar or inappropriate language, showing a lack of restraint in my interactions?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others using language that was hurtful, insulting, or degrading?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control in your conversations and speak to others with coarse or unbecoming language, thus violating their dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

impiety.question: Did I engage in work on Sundays, knowing that it could be avoided?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).
